metadata.synopsis: During the scene where she scratches you. Nettie is in the lab, sitting at a table, studiying Halsin's notes. The player can still try to persuade her to give the antidote. The player must also accept to take the wyvern poison. The other choice is to kill Nettie.

0.speaker: Nettie
0.text: If it helps, she won't feel any pain. It's the best death I can give her.
0.context: NodeContext: Talking to non-infected player about infected player

14.speaker: Nettie
14.text: I hope your friend sees sense soon. They don't have much time left.
14.context: NodeContext: caught in a tough place

107.speaker: Nettie
107.text: I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know they'll take the wyvern poison if they start to change.
107.context: NodeContext: caught in a tough place

132.speaker: Nettie
132.text: I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know they'll do what has to be done, if it comes to that.
132.context: NodeContext: caught in a tough place

23.speaker: Nettie
23.text: I hope your friend sees sense soon. He doesn't have much time left.
23.context: NodeContext: Talking to non-infected player about infected player

36.speaker: Nettie
36.text: I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know he'll take the wyvern poison if he starts to change.
36.context: NodeContext: caught in a tough place

33.speaker: Nettie
33.text: I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know he'll do what has to be done, if it comes to that.
33.context: NodeContext: caught in a tough place

51.speaker: Nettie
51.text: And? Will you swear you'd die before you turn?
51.context: InternalNodeContext: She doesn't have the wyvern poison in her inventory, player pickpocketed it already

18.speaker: Player
18.text: By my sacred oath, I swear it.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gives player vial of poison

2.speaker: Nettie
2.text: I hope it doesn't come to that but... thank you. Here.
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gives player vial of poison

143.speaker: Nettie
143.text: And here's the antidote. Do not mix those two up.
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie hands you the antidoteNodeContext: Hands you the antidote. 'Don't mix them up' refers to the antidote and the poison

67.speaker: Nettie
67.text: Now, I've an antidote - um... where is the bloody thing?
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Drinks the AntidoteNodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

39.speaker: Nettie
39.text: Well, not to worry. Have a read of that book - Flora of the Dalelands. There's a recipe for your antidote in there. It won't do anything for what's in your skull, though.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Drinks the AntidoteNodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

146.text: I've spent my life treating folk and never once saw a mind flayer infection. Then suddenly there's dozens of you - maybe more.
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Drinks the AntidoteNodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

4.speaker: Nettie
4.text: I've spent my life treating folk and never once saw a mind flayer infection. Then suddenly there's dozens of you - maybe more.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Drinks the AntidoteNodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

41.speaker: Nettie
41.text: Master Halsin and I were tracking them, studying them, trying to figure out what the hells was going on.
41.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

20.speaker: Nettie
20.text: Because you should all be changing - there should be a small army of mind flayers out there! But you're not. Weird powers aside, you seem perfectly normal.
20.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: What do you mean 'should' be changing?
89.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

136.speaker: Nettie
136.text: Mind flayers reproduce by infecting someone with their parasite. Seven gruesome days later, the victim transforms and a new mind flayer is born.

115.speaker: Nettie
115.text: The thing in your skull, though? It's different to anything in our records.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: You must've learned something from studying them.
49.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

26.speaker: Nettie
26.text: For one, that thing in your head is like nothing we've ever seen from mind flayers.
26.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

46.speaker: Nettie
46.text: It's one of their worms, for sure, but this one gives you powers - telepathic connections. And it doesn't turn you into one of them.
46.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

95.speaker: Nettie
95.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

68.speaker: Player
68.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: So you think it's only a matter of time?
28.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

8.speaker: Nettie
8.text: Could be, but there's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.
8.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

129.speaker: Nettie
129.text: When Master Halsin heard the adventurers were heading that way, he saw a chance to get answers. Joined on the spot.
129.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

130.speaker: Nettie
130.text: Whatever he found there, he didn't make it back.
130.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: What do you want me to do?
91.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

90.speaker: Nettie
90.text: The thing is, I've sent birds to find him, but the place is rotten with goblins. None of us can even get close.

125.speaker: Player
125.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

72.speaker: Nettie
72.text: I've sent birds to find him, but the place is rotten with goblins. And if my birds can't get close, what chance do I have?

56.speaker: Player
56.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

12.speaker: Nettie
12.text: I think so. I hope so. I've sent birds to find him, but they can't get close without goblins trying to shoot them down.
12.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

104.speaker: Nettie
104.text: You, though? You're one of them - technically speaking, I mean. They might not kill someone carrying their parasite.
104.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

120.speaker: Nettie
120.text: If you can find Halsin and get him out of there, we can discover what he learned. And perhaps he can save your life. How's that sound?
120.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I already know where to find him: the worg pens of the goblin camp.
79.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

60.speaker: Nettie
60.text: Gods above - why didn't you say so?
60.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

100.speaker: Nettie
100.text: Please, you have to bring him back to us. For your own sake as much as ours.

65.speaker: Nettie
65.text: Thank you. It would mean everything to the grove. To me.

57.speaker: Nettie
57.text: I wish I could tell you what happened out there, but those adventurers were the only witnesses. And they're long gone.

47.speaker: Nettie
47.text: All I can say for sure is they all went to the old temple of Selûne and Master Halsin didn't make it back.

94.speaker: Nettie
94.text: Good luck out there. And if things start to go bad - remember the oath you swore.

13.speaker: Nettie
13.text: Good luck out there. And if things start to go bad - remember the vial. Remember your oath.

108.speaker: Nettie
108.text: I wish I could tell you more, but only those adventurers know what happened out there.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: It sounds like you're making a lot of assumptions that could kill me.

24.speaker: Nettie
24.text: The way I see it, you have two options: Halsin or that wyvern poison.

42.speaker: Nettie
42.text: I don't envy your choice, truly. But this is the hand fate's dealt you.

116.speaker: Nettie
116.text: The way I see it, you have two options: Halsin or death - whatever form it takes.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: You're sure he can cure me?

96.speaker: Nettie
96.text: I can't make any promises. This is like nothing we've seen before.

44.speaker: Nettie
44.text: But I know this for sure: Master Halsin is the only one close to understanding these things. He's your best bet to survive.

101.speaker: Nettie
101.text: Otherwise, that vial's your only option.

40.speaker: Nettie
40.text: Otherwise you'll need to end things yourself, before the transformation really takes hold.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: That sounds like suicide. I won't do it.

48.speaker: Nettie
48.text: It might be suicide either way. Trust me, you do not want to become one of those monsters.

140.speaker: Nettie
140.text: But of course, the choice is yours. I just hope you find a cure out there.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: You said you were tracking other victims. Did they change?

99.speaker: Nettie
99.text: Hard to say, but there's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Excellent news! All the power, none of the tentacles.

123.speaker: Nettie
123.text: I wouldn't be so sure. There's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Just tell me if there's a cure or not.

38.speaker: Nettie
38.text: You can't cure what you don't understand. And as much as I know about mind flayers, I can't make heads nor tails of this.

135.speaker: Nettie
135.text: I've spent my life treating folk and never once saw a mind flayer infection. Then suddenly there's dozens of you - maybe more.
135.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Drinks the AntidoteNodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

59.speaker: Nettie
59.text: Thank you. I truly hope it doesn't come to that.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie hands you the antidoteNodeContext: Nettie hands you the antidote

50.speaker: Nettie
50.text: Here, take this. It'll stop the poison, but I can't do anything for that wriggler in your head.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie hands you the antidoteNodeContext: Nettie hands you the antidote

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Fine, just give it to me.

64.speaker: Nettie
64.text: Yes? Is there anything I can do?
64.context: NodeContext: A little sadly. She wants to save you, but feels that she morally can't.

128.speaker: Nettie
128.context: NodeContext: A little sadly. She wants to save you, but feels that she morally can't.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I know where Halsin is! Give me the antidote or he'll die too!
62.context: NodeContext: Realises that if she acts quickly, she can save her mentor.

145.speaker: Nettie
145.text: Hells' teeth. All right. I'll tell you where the antidote is, but there's a condition.
145.context: NodeContext: Realises that if she acts quickly, she can save her mentor.

133.speaker: Nettie
133.text: This is a vial of wyvern poison. Swear to me you'll swallow it if you feel any symptoms.
133.context: NodeContext: 'you'll end things yourself' = you'll kill yourself.

105.speaker: Nettie
105.text: Swear to me that if you feel any symptoms, you'll end things yourself.
105.context: NodeContext: 'you'll end things yourself' = you'll kill yourself.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: We can both see I have no symptoms - I'm not about to change!

114.text: Same as the drow... But Master Halsin said he'd turn eventually.

102.speaker: Nettie
102.text: Same as the drow... But Master Halsin said he'd turn eventually.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Eventually? That gives me time to find a cure.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!

7.speaker: Player
7.text: The grove is in terrible danger - cure me and I'll tell your leader how to save it.

29.speaker: Nettie
29.text: All right! Master Halsin thought the tadpole was dormant, so you have some time. Perhaps it's only fair I let you use it.

6.speaker: Nettie
6.text: All right! Master Halsin thought the tadpole was dormant, so you have some time. Perhaps it's only fair I let you use it.

88.speaker: Nettie
88.text: But first - this is a vial of wyvern poison. Swear to me you'll swallow it if you feel any symptoms.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds out vial of poisonNodeContext: Firm tone. Holds out vial of poison

85.speaker: Nettie
85.text: But first - swear to me that if you feel any symptoms, you'll end things yourself.
85.context: NodeContext: Firm tone. 'you'll end things yourself' = you'll kill yourself.

144.text: I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.

134.speaker: Nettie
134.text: I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.

43.speaker: Nettie
43.text: The door's locked. Neither of us are leaving until this is done.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: It's been days. If I were going to turn, it would've happened by now.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Recite what you know of her order - this can't be allowed!

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Recite what you know of her order - this can't be allowed!

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Recite her order's druidic law - this can't be allowed!

124.speaker: Player
124.text: You can't do this - your leader needs to talk to me.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: You can't do this - I'm on a secret mission. Everything depends on it.
138.context: NodeContext: Sill-van-us, the god Nettie worships

82.text: It doesn't matter if you're Silvanus himself come to walk among us - infected is infected.
82.context: NodeContext: Sill-van-us, the god Nettie worships

110.speaker: Nettie
110.text: It doesn't matter if you're Silvanus himself come to walk among us - infected is infected.
110.context: NodeContext: Sill-van-us, the god Nettie worships

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Try to recall the tenets of her order - she can't support this!

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Try to recall the tenets of her order - she can't support this!

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Try to recall the tenets of her order - no druid could support this!

27.text: I know you're angry, but how many people would die if you changed? I can't take that risk.

55.speaker: Nettie
55.text: I know you're angry, but how many people would die if you changed? I can't take that risk.

76.speaker: Nettie
76.text: There's no stopping you, is there?

81.speaker: Nettie
81.text: I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.

87.speaker: Nettie
87.text: I hope your friend sees sense soon. She doesn't have much time left.
87.context: NodeContext: Talking to non-infected player about infected player

22.speaker: Nettie
22.text: I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know she'll take the wyvern poison if she starts to change.
22.context: NodeContext: caught in a tough place

131.speaker: Nettie
131.text: I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know she'll do what has to be done, if it comes to that.
131.context: NodeContext: caught in a tough place

92.speaker: Nettie
92.text: And? Will you swear you'll take the poison?
92.context: InternalNodeContext: She has the wyvern poison in her inventory

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Have you lost your mind? No!
97.context: NodeContext: Player's cured themselves and may escape from the room you've locked them in

127.speaker: Nettie
127.text: I don't want to hurt you, but I can't let you live. You're too dangerous.
127.context: NodeContext: Player's cured themselves and may escape from the room you've locked them in

25.speaker: Nettie
25.context: NodeContext: You're about to attack the player with a poisoned thorn

17.speaker: Nettie
17.text: Then we've nothing more to talk about.
17.context: NodeContext: Player refuses to take your poison, you refuse to let them out.

112.speaker: Nettie
112.text: If it helps, they won't feel any pain. It's the best death I can give them.
112.context: NodeContext: Surprised "you're alive?"  but then sadly resigned. She didn't want to let you go.

113.speaker: Nettie
113.text: You're alive? There's no way I'm stopping you, is there?
113.context: NodeContext: Surprised "you're alive?"  but then sadly resigned. She didn't want to let you go.

118.speaker: Nettie
118.text: If it helps, he won't feel any pain. It's the best death I can give him.
118.context: NodeContext: Talking to non-infected player about infected player
